34049663.given_title: A Neighborhood of Infinity: Data and Codata
34049663.excerpt: In Gödel, Escher, Bach, Hofstadter introduces the programming language Bloop. Bloop is a little like BASIC except that it forces programmers to specify in advance how many times each loop will iterate. As a result, Bloop programs have the handy property that they are guaranteed to terminate.
